thread.section_title: Kensington Gardens Hotel - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (London, England) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: A great place to crash for the night
thread.title_full: A great place to crash for the night - Review of Kensington Gardens Hotel, London, England - TripAdvisor

author: Gregory B
title: A great place to crash for the night
text:
We needed a place to crash after seeing a show at the Royal Hall, given that most of London is expensive, the ~Â£80 for a night was a fair price.
The hotel is located just north of Kensington Gardens, and has close tube stations and shops. It seems to be paired with another hotel two doors down, as check in was directed to the Phoenix Hotel, via the door buzzer system.
Check in was lovely, the room was a well looked after basic set up. Two single beds smooshed (this is now a word) together. TV, hairdryer and basic show gels. Also had tea and coffee with biscuits. So for a two star, pretty good.
Room and bathroom were very clean and of a high standard.
Only slight issue was shower not fitting very well onto the hook on the shower, but only a minor niggle.
Would happily stop there again!
